subject: TestSetup usage question
msgSnippet: Hi, I m trying to understand how to use the TestSetup class as a decorator to do some setup for some test classes. If the setup is done in a subclass of
messageBody:
Hi,

I'm trying to understand how to use the TestSetup class as a
decorator to do some setup for some test classes.

If the setup is done in a subclass of TestSetup class and this wraps
a TestCase subclass, how do the test methods in say, MyTestCase
access the objects created in MyTestSetup.setUp() ? In the decorator
pattern, there is no way for the component to access the contained
object's data.

- Srikanth


eg: Java Pseudo code

class MyTestSetup extends TestSetup
{
private myData;

protected void setup() {
// set myData
}
}

class MyTestCase extends TestCase
{
// Set name in myData
public void testMyName() {
// How do I access myData here ????
myData.setName("abc");
assertTrue(myData.getName().equals("abc"));
}
}

Usage :

Test myTest = MyTestSetup(new MyTestCase());
